title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Amelia Mead to R. M. Manly, November 11, 1869
summary: Mead, a teacher in Staunton, asks Manly for advice on where they should request funds to build an additional room on their school building, and to equip it with supplies. Mead reports an ever-growing number of students.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Administration/Bureaucracy, Education, American Civil War
